shapes

Class Ellipse

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
      • shapes.Ellipse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable, Translateable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle

    public class Ellipse
extends Shape
    A class to represent any ellipse. Stores the width and height (the length of the horizontal and vertical axes).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • calculateArea

        protected double calculateArea()
        Calculates and returns the area of this Shape. It is almost certainly a better idea to use Shape.getArea() instead, as that stores the result so the calculation only occurs once.

        The formula used is PI * semi-minor axis * semi-major axis.

        Specified by:
        calculateArea in class Shape
        Returns:
        double, the area of this Shape.

      • calculatePerimeter

        protected double calculatePerimeter()
        Calculates and returns the perimeter of this Shape. It is almost certainly a better idea to use Shape.getPerimeter() instead, as that stores the result so the calculation only occurs once.

        The formula used is one of Ramanujan's approximations for the circumference of an ellipse: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellipse#Circumference.

        Though a and b are supposed to be the semi-major and semi-minor axes (with a >= b), it does not matter in this formula whether a >= b or not, so there is no need to check.

        Specified by:
        calculatePerimeter in class Shape
        Returns:
        double, the perimeter of this Shape.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Description copied from class: Shape
        Draws this object onto the specified Graphics object.

        The Shape should be drawn such that the coordinates of the top left corner of the bounding box is equal to the coordinates specified in the x and y attributes of this Shape.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface Drawable
        Specified by:
        draw in class Shape
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to draw to.
